name: viola nuttallii
description: New! Threatened in MN. It can have a cleistagamous flower; a non-opening flower that can self-pollinate. This phenonomeon is well-documented in grasses, but also in peanuts, pansy, and pea plants. Also called Nuttall's Violet. *This species (in seed) may be difficult and/or slow to germinate and grow to maturity.  Please note the germination code, right.
